channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Parking on pavement, 16th February
item.description:
Parking on the pavement on both sides of Gayton Road (a no parking zone) is a hazard to pedestrians and is causing damage to the pavement. Enforcement is needed, especially in the morning and evening peak travel times. The concrete blocks have been moved on the north side of Gayton Road. These did provide some protection.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gayton Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large and deep pothole, 16th February
item.description:
The road has a dangerous pothole that almost caused an accident when I was driving at night as it can't be seen in the dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Circular Road, Little Ilford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian island keep left sign lights bulbs out x 3 different center islands, 16th February
item.description:
Along the length of Welling Way there are 3 separate central pedestrian islands in the middle of the roadway that do not have lighting of the "KEEP LEFT" arrows lit. Makes the central islands hard to see at night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Welling Way, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed dumped vehicle, 16th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ancaster Street, Plumstead

item.title: Abandoned bike, 16th February
item.description:
This bike has been chained here for at least two years. I have reported it twice before here but nothing has been done. The bikeâ€™s basket / container is now being used as a de facto rubbish bin. (See photos)

item.title: Fence falling down, 16th February
item.description:
I have reported this issue several times and nothing has been done. My fence is breaking due to the amount of rubbish being dumped by the side. I was told it will be dealt with several times still nothing. Please I would like this issue to be resolved soon.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kentlea Road, Thamesmead
